general_advisory: According to MC, Bhubaneswar forecast, district may receive dry weather with light rain at some places in the next 5 days, provide needful irrigation to crops and vegetables.

advisory: Prepare well pulverised nursery bed for Kharif Rice. Sowing of pre-generated seeds should be done after seed treatment with Carbendazim @ 2 gm along with Plantomycin @ 1 gm per Kg seed.
Instead of manual DSR followed by beushaning, farmers are advised to follow mechanized DSR cultivation with appropriate package of practices (Variety selection, Seed treatment, Nutrient management).
Farmers are advised to go for summer ploughing by utilizing the rain received in recent past days.
Arrange good quality seeds of @12kg/acre as green manuring crop.
Wrapping and propping should be done when the crop becomes 4-5 months old in medium and late duration varieties.
To control early shot borer in sugarcane, foliar spray of Fipronil 5SC @400 ml/acre is advised.
For timely planting of kharif vegetables like Brinjal & Chilli, prepare the nursery bed & treat the seed with (Carboxin + Thiram) @2g/kg of seed.
To control different viral diseases in bitter gourd, cucumber, and other cuucurbits crop apply 120 ml Abamectin or 30 gm Fipronil 80 WG per acre.

To control Fruit and shoot borer in Brinjal, Tomato & Okra, Spray Neem-based pesticide 1500ppm @600ml/acre at initial stages. Later on go for alternate spray of Spinosad 45 SC @70ml/acre or Emamectin benzoate @80-100g/acre & Thiachloprid@250ml/l of water.
Considering high day temperature, water depth in the fish pond should be raised from 0.8 m to 1.0 m by adding fresh water.

Reduce the quantity of feed by 10-20% compared to normal condition and make provision for supplying cool water into the pond, so that the temperature remains in the range of 13-18Â°C for as long as possible.
If the animals have not yet been vaccinated against FMD, Haemorrhagic Septicaemia, Black Quarter, Enterotoxemia etc., these must be done.

Animals should be given mineral mixture along with salt regularly and wheat grains, jaggery, etc. may be provided @ 10%-20% in the daily ration during the winter season to meet the energy requirement of the animals.
